title: Rumpole - Radio Drama
description:
13 x 30 mins

Rumpole is the wonderful creation of John Mortimer, himself a barrister, and one suspects not too different from Rumpole himself. Maurice Denham plays an avuncular Rumpole, who refers to judges as "an old sweetheart", is forever in trouble with the more ambitious members of his Chambers, and can be found imbibing a bottle of "ChÃƒÂ¢teau Thames Embankment" budget claret at Pomeroy's Wine Bar.

Delightful listening. The Timothy West / Benedict Cumberbatch iterations of Rumpole are posted elsewhere, or will be in due course.
